sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Desmond Tutu, long-time non-violent campaigner against apartheid in South Africa and poverty around the world, has died aged 90.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: More people are rescued from the Mediterranean Sea on Christmas Day as one ship docks in

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Italy with 214 people on board.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Desmond Tutu was the former Archbishop of Cape Town who became South Africa's Nobel Peace Prize-winning activist for racial justice and LGBT rights, and he was admired by everyone who came across him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: DESMOND TUTU, Archbishop of Cape Town, South Africa I also, you see, learned some very useful advice from him. So, since today, I will keep

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: in my mind one of his advice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Tutu was also an African leader who helped guide the continent through its darkest hours in Rwanda and elsewhere.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And he helped bring down the white racist apartheid regime that had oppressed South Africans for decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: On the international stage, he supported pro-democracy leaders such as Myanmar's Aung San Suu Kyi. This is how he wanted to be remembered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: He loved. He laughed. He cried. He was forgiven. He forgave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But most of all, he was instrumental in ending apartheid and constructing what he lovingly called the Rainbow Nation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It's been a busy time for the crew of CI4, which was recently allowed to dock in the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Sicilian port of Trapani. On board were 214 people rescued from the Mediterranean Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: This comes as another ship, the Sea Watch 3, made multiple rescues over the last few days and is now taking care of 350 people. They are the lucky ones. Others were less lucky. This boat capsized late on Christmas Eve off the Greek island of Paros. 16 bodies were found, including a baby, while 63 people were rescued.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: At the other end of Europe, Polish guards patrol the border with Belarus amid reports of crossing. Even through Christmas time, there were 69 attempts, although it seems most were returned to the Belarusian side. As a new year dawns, it seems the plight of people fleeing their countries and associated challenges for Europe are set to stay.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Backed by the central band of the Royal British Legion, Queen Elizabeth II empathised with those mourning loved ones at Christmas, while paying tribute to her late husband, Prince Philip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Although it's a time of great happiness and good cheer for many, Christmas can be hard for those who have lost loved ones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This year especially, I understand why.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But for me, in the months since the death of my beloved Philip, I have drawn great comfort from the warmth and affection of the many tributes to his life and work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: From around the country the commonwealth and the world in germany president frank volta steinmeier used his message to warn against the division of society since the start of the pandemic he said we feel that after two years frustration irritation polarization and unfortunately also ostensible aggressiveness are setting in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's true that in a democracy, we don't all have to agree.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But let us not forget that we are one country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We must be able to look at each other in the eye, even after the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Hi, Merry Christmas. How are you?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: US President and First Lady Joe and Jill Biden thanked US troops abroad in their messages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: You're the solid steel spine of the nation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: You really are.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Always vigilant, always ready when duty calls, 365 days a year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And during the holiday season, as we pray for peace and spread joy and glad tidings, we also look for hope toward the possibility of a a year. And during the holiday season, as we pray for peace and spread joy and glad tidings, we also look for hope toward the possibility of a better year and to give thanks and to give thanks to everything, for everything we've gotten.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Christmas weekend has suffered many flight cancellations as Omicron continues to disrupt

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: daily life in many countries. Over 1,500 flights had been cancelled by Sunday morning in the U.S. At Minneapolis-St. Paul Airport in the state of Minnesota, many travelers voiced their frustrations. It actually cancelled while we were in line to check in. We are not usually the family that travels on Christmas, so this is our first time giving them a shot and maybe last. I booked this trip in February. We had no idea that we'd still be dealing with COVID. It's crazy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Cancellations and flight delays related to staff shortages have been a persistent problem for the American airline industry this year. Last year, after air travel collapsed, U.S. airlines encouraged workers to quit. But this year, air travel has mostly recovered, and they've left themselves short-staffed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In the UK, the vaccine and booster rollout hasn't stopped for Christmas. Thousands

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: of people were jabbed on Saturday. But Omicron is still rising. New cases hit another daily record of over 122,000 cases on Christmas Day. And the government hasn't ruled out further restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I just thought that it would be quite quiet today. And I was right. There was only one person ahead of me in the queue and I wanted my booster jab and here I am.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In the Netherlands, people are celebrating Christmas under a strict lockdown. All non-essential shops, cafes and other places won't open again until January 14th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We are celebrating Christmas most of all with friends, but not too many if it is not possible these days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And otherwise we're going out for a walk, see people but from a distance, but it is very quiet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Portugal, over 10,000 Covid cases were registered on Christmas day, most of them the Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The government's now ordered that bars and nightclubs will be shut from Sunday to January 9th and people will also have to work from home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And in Barcelona, hundreds of people protested on Christmas Day against new restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: There's now a nightly curfew from 1 to 6am and a limit of 10 people at social gatherings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: curfew from 1 to 6 am and a limit of 10 people at social gatherings. Thousands of Sudanese protesters took to the streets two months after a military coup.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: They demanded that soldiers go back to the barracks and called for a transition to full civilian rule.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: At least 48 have been killed in weeks of protest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: General Al Burun seized power before reinstating civilian leader Hamdok in late November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: However, many people have refused to accept this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Krylov was just one when the Soviet Union collapsed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As a student, he became interested in communist ideology and decided to join the party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: ideology and decided to join the party Vladimir is a strong supporter of socialist ideas and says the collapse of the USSR was a huge loss this is just an idealized attitude to what happened people have forgotten about deficit poverty repression and so on but this is an expression of the dissatisfaction with the present situation many other other people in Russia, especially those who spent part of their lives in the USSR,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: also reminisce about the country that collapsed 30 years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Of course it was better in the Soviet Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: My entire childhood was in the Soviet Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I am sorry for my memories, for my childhood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's been branded a foreign agent in Russia, but a recent poll by the Levada Center showed a majority of Russians, 63%, regretted the collapse of the USSR.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Â«This is not just an idealized attitude to what happened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: People have forgotten about the deficit, poverty, repression and so on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But this is an expression of the dissatisfaction with the present situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Experts say the main reasons for this lament over the Soviet Union's demise stems from the loss of the idea of once belonging to a great power and a unified economic system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The country's entire policy is aimed at glorifying the past, the past of the Soviet Union in which we were strong, powerful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We were on a par with other major powers who could dictate our position. And this is broadcast through the media who dominate our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In many of the former Soviet republics, there has been a radical move away from the Soviet model, with Soviet symbols being prohibited.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Russia, this is out of the question.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The authorities here say that the Soviet era is a part of Russian history that should not be erased.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews from Moscow.
